Heres an amazing brownie recipe 

b Ingredients b
1 12 cups granulated sugar
34 cup allpurpose flour
23 cup cocoa powder sifted if lumpy
12 cup powdered sugar sifted if lumpy
12 cup dark chocolate chips
34 teaspoons sea salt
2 large eggs
12 cup canola oil or extravirgin olive oil
2 tablespoons water
12 teaspoon vanilla

b Instructions b
Preheat the oven to 325F Lightly spray an 8x8 baking dish not a 9x9 dish or your brownies will overcook with cooking spray and line it with parchment paper Spray the parchment paper
In a medium bowl combine the sugar flour cocoa powder powdered sugar chocolate chips and salt
In a large bowl whisk together the eggs olive oil water and vanilla
Sprinkle the dry mix over the wet mix and stir until just combined
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and use a spatula to smooth the top Bake for 40 to 48 minutes or until a toothpick comes out with only a few crumbs attached Cool completely before slicing Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days These also freeze well

Traditional cannoli cream uses a sheeps milk ricotta which I prefer  if I can get my hands on it Any other high fat unpasteurized milk will work Or if you want to cut some corners or are tight on time you can start off with any decent premade ricotta Skip the low fat stuff youre making cannoli

3 cups of drained ricotta

13 cups of confectioners sugar

15 tsp vanilla

Orange Zest

Using a hand or stand mixer whip together these ingredients for a few minutes until well incorporated Transfer from a bowl to a piping bag and keep in the refrigerator until ready to use

The Shells

This is part that can easily go wrong and where you need to have a zen mindset This recipe makes about 45 small to medium sized shells

15 cups of all purpose Flour

5 tsp cinnamon powder

15 tsp cocoa powder

2 tbsp white sugar

5 tsp salt

3 tbsp cubed and chilled butter

2 tbsp Marsala

5 tsp white vinegar

25 cup of water

1 egg for the wash

Heat a neutral high heat oil to 350F in a deep pot or fryer

In stand mixer combine all of the dry ingredients and mix well Add in wet ingredients except the egg and continue to blend for a few minutes Mixture will be somewhat crumbly Remove from the bowl and pour out onto a large working surface

Knead with your hands for 5  10 minutes until you have a mostly smooth and homogeneous ball of dough Wrap in plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature for 1 hour

Remove the dough from the plastic and cut into about 5 smaller pieces Flour the dough balls gently Pass each ball through the pasta maker going from the widest setting down about 6 settings Be slow and methodical and dont skip any steps

Lay each sheet of dough out on your work surface and gently flour again Using your circular punch out form cut circles and save all of the excess dough which youll use for one final pass through the pasta maker

Carefully and tightly wraproll each cut circle around the cannoli tube and seal the edge with your egg wash Be extremely careful not to let egg get all over the place Avoid getting the egg on the cannoli tube or the dough will end up sticking to the tube while frying Clean up any egg that gets on your work surface

When the oil temperature has reached 350F drop each tube into the oil and fry until golden Using tongs turn the cannoli in the oil so they cook evenly This should take only about 1 minute

Transfer to a rack lined with paper towels and carefully slide the shells off of the tubes while its still hot Youll want to use more paper towels so you dont burn your fingers

The tubes should be wiped down and chilled in the refrigerator for just 1  2 minutes before starting the next round of shells This avoids a lot of mess ups

The finishing touches

Once the shells have completely cooled you can start filling the cannoli This is made easier as a two person task and makes for a fun family activity but is manageable by one person if necessary Using the piping bag fill each shell starting with the center and working outwards Nothing worse than a cannoli with a big empty pocket of air in the middle Once completely filled you can garnish with whatever you like Traditional toppings include candied fruit crushed pistachio or chocolate chips When the cannoli are all dressed up and ready to go you can give them all a final dusting of confectioners sugar They should be eaten fresh as they start to lose their textural appeal if they sit around too long and get soggy

What can be said about Grand Theft Auto V that hasnt already been said a million times This game is a masterpiece and I am blown away by how modern it feels even 10 years after its release Sure the controls can be a bit janky and the story gets messy towards the end but as an all around experience it still holds up incredibly well Every time I play this game I feel like I went on vacation to California The world feels so alive and its full of many activities The attention to detail is absolutely mindboggling The minigames actually have plenty of depth to them You can spend hours playing golf and tennis or cruising around and taking in the sights at various beaches mountains and forests Car customization is very deep and rivals every racing game out there that was out in 2013 Also a special shout out to the soundtrack which is full of every genre you can think of and ranges from old school throwbacks to modern for 2013 music to even some updated recent songs that released long after GTA V came out Although the story may not please everyone this game has some of the most memorable characters in all of gaming Franklin Trevor Michael Lamar even the yoga instructor are all unforgettable characters There is constantly something fun going on in this game and theres never a dull moment

After almost 500 hours of gameplay inside and outside of Steam I can confidently tell you that Rockstar treats its player base horribly So many parts of the Online experience are forced to be done solo as they have no benefit to doing them with friends Payouts for almost every single activity is minimal and feels like a spit in the face after you realize grinding for 100 hours will only net you disappointment Every part of the Online experience is there to punch you in the dick and then hand you a single ice cube to make it sting a little less but Rockstar are still the ones who did the kicking in the first place

If you want to play this game for its online be prepared to ditch all public lobbies since they have at least one hacker in them at all times All things worth doing will be done in a Crew only lobby or in a closed mission where you can typically only bring in 3 friends Rockstar may keep pushing horrible content updates that give you new ways to waste time but theyre never going to be worth investing your time Do not buy this game do not buy their next GTA just dont waste your time with these disrespectful developers

Positive GTA 5 is a powerful continuation of a legendary gaming series that has captured my heart since its early days The games strength lies in its extensive and captivating story which can be experienced from three different character perspectives providing the game with incredible replayability and depth Each character is uniquely designed and contributes to a rich and engaging world full of life and adventure The multiplayer aspect also shines with a variety of missions and activities that can be undertaken solo or with friends creating dynamic and unpredictable gaming scenarios

Negative Despite the many positive aspects the multiplayer part receives criticism for going overboard with certain elements especially when it comes to the introduction of overly futuristic vehicles like flying motorcycles For me this has disrupted the realistic and downtoearth feel that the GTA series has traditionally aimed for creating an imbalance in the games dynamics

Summary GTA 5 stands as a titan in the gaming world with a rich and dynamic narrative memorable characters and a fun and extensive multiplayer mode While some elements in multiplayer may feel exaggerated the games overall offering is still of an exceptional caliber that few other games can match For longtime fans and new players alike GTA 5 offers a world filled with adventure laughter and excitement

Grand Theft Auto V GTA 5 is an exhilarating and immersive gaming experience that offers a compelling blend of action adventure and openworld exploration Released to critical acclaim this title from Rockstar Games boasts a meticulously crafted virtual rendition of Los Santos a sprawling metropolis teeming with life and opportunities The games narrative intricately weaves together the lives of three diverse protagonists each with their own compelling storylines creating a rich tapestry of crime intrigue and unexpected twists Beyond the captivating storyline GTA 5 provides an expansive sandbox environment that encourages player agency allowing you to shape your own criminal empire engage in thrilling heists and indulge in a plethora of side activities from highspeed chases to leisurely pastimes like golf and tennis With stunning visuals a dynamic soundtrack and an online multiplayer component that ensures endless entertainment GTA 5 remains a timeless and musthave addition to any gaming library promising countless hours of excitement and exploration

Entertaining moment are sandwiched in between long travel times The travelling does get very boring to the point where you just end up taking the taxi everywhere as it is more efficient
The open world while very lively and believable is pretty shallow and lacks content
Minus the travel times the missions are fine but each mission lacks a strong tie to the story to the point where a lot of the missions feel like filler stuff just so the gang can do interesting things This leads to moments where there isnt something to keep you looking forward to the next thing
There is stat upgrades like better stamina or better shooting which you upgrade by using that actual stat If you run a lot then your stamina will upgrade Overall the upgrades are minimal and dont end up changing your play style

I am a 45 year old father probably one of the oldest people playing this game I am a single father raising my son who is now 14 years old My son won this game from his uncle so we installed him on his computer and he started playing Until the end of the week he had 24 hours in this game This was horrible for me because it was hard to find ways to spend time with my son because he is always with friends or just watching Youtube So I decided to do a Steam account and get this game to see if I could play beside him I bought the game chose my skin and world and started playing but I was stuck in what you should do I asked my son for help and he organized a game for me to participate I loved it because it was the best time I spent with my son since my wife died Since then this game has approached me and my son again and now we spend time together away from home as well This game reminded me that there is fun in everything and I brought many happy memories to me and my son

Grand Theft Auto V isnt just a game its a memory its broken the barrier past nostalgia and become something entirely different Every moment in the fictional city of Los Santos is a testament to the care and detail the developers have poured into this creation Its not just the stunning visuals or the dynamic soundtrack that make this game a masterpiece but the way it makes you feel part of an expansive living world The story woven through the lives of Michael Trevor and Franklin is more than just a series of missions its a journey through their wild lives and achieves a level of immersion that I have yet to replicate in other games today

The heart of GTA 5 lies in its ability to offer something for everyone Whether youre tearing through the streets in a highspeed chase enjoying a quiet moment watching the sunset over the Vinewood hills or teaming up with friends in GTA Online the game seamlessly blends adrenalinepumping action with quiet moments Its this balance that makes the experience so memorable GTAV will always keep its position as top 5 games ive ever played I remember being 11 years old with my PS3 going to that gamestop with my mom and getting the game bringing it home launching the game and hearing that echo of the siren in the loading screen Nothing beats this feeling and I dont think anything will come close to this for any other generation

Red lentil chickpea  chilli soup

if youre looking for review on this game youve come to the wrong place but if youre looking for an outstanding Red lentil chickpea  chilli soup recipe youve come to the right place

Ingredients

2 tsp cumin seeds
large pinch chilli flakes
1 tbsp olive oil
1 red onion chopped
140g red split lentils
850ml vegetable stock or water
400g can tomatoes whole or chopped
4 tbsp 0 Greek yogurt to serve

200g can chickpeas or ½ a can drained and rinsed freeze leftovers

small bunch coriander roughly chopped save a few leaves to serve

Directions

STEP 1
Heat a large saucepan and dryfry 2 tsp cumin seeds and a large pinch of chilli flakes for 1 min or until they start to jump around the pan and release their aromas

STEP 2
Add 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 chopped red onion and cook for 5 mins

STEP 3
Stir in 140g red split lentils 850ml vegetable stock or water and a 400g can tomatoes then bring to the boil Simmer for 15 mins until the lentils have softened

STEP 4
Whizz the soup with a stick blender or in a food processor until it is a rough purée pour back into the pan and add a 200g can drained and rinsed chickpeas

STEP 5
Heat gently season well and stir in a small bunch of chopped coriander reserving a few leaves to serve Finish with 4 tbsp 0 Greek yogurt and extra coriander leaves

Grand Theft Auto V GTA 5 is an absolute masterpiece that continues to captivate players with its unparalleled openworld experience dynamic characters and immersive gameplay Released in 2013 the game has stood the test of time and remains a shining example of what an openworld actionadventure game can achieve

One of the most impressive aspects of GTA 5 is its vast and meticulously crafted open world the fictional state of San Andreas The attention to detail is extraordinary with a diverse range of landscapes from bustling urban environments to serene countryside and picturesque coastal areas The level of detail in the game world is staggering and it creates an incredibly immersive experience for players

The game features three playable protagonistsMichael Trevor and Franklineach with their own distinct personality background and set of skills This innovative approach to storytelling adds depth to the narrative and allows players to experience the storyline from multiple perspectives The character development is exceptional and the writing is topnotch making each protagonist memorable in their own right

GTA 5 excels in offering a wide variety of activities beyond the main storyline From adrenalinepumping heists and thrilling car chases to golf tennis and base jumping the game provides an extensive range of diversions to keep players engaged for hours on end The attention to detail extends to the side missions and activities making them just as enjoyable as the main storyline

The games graphics and attention to realism are outstanding even years after its initial release The level of detail in the character models vehicles and environments is remarkable and the games lighting effects contribute to a visually stunning experience

Furthermore GTA Online the multiplayer component of GTA 5 adds another layer of longevity to the game With a vast open world to explore cooperative and competitive missions and a constant stream of updates and new content GTA Online provides endless hours of entertainment for players

In conclusion Grand Theft Auto V is a landmark achievement in the gaming industry Its combination of a richly detailed open world compelling characters engaging storyline and diverse gameplay options make it a mustplay for any fan of the actionadventure genre Even years after its release GTA 5 continues to be a shining example of the incredible potential of video games as an art form and entertainment medium

Yes for the 10 I paid for it but its a very flawed game and a sign of the low standards of gaming today

This one is by far the best GTA yet and also still shows their failings in knowing how to advance the series This game like all GTA games is a fun chaos simulator When the game tries to be serious the flawed mechanics are obvious Its clear Rockstar has no intention of improving them much

The first thing I noticed is Rockstar doesnt respect their players This was a single player series that now focuses on multiplayer and the single player game is hurt for it The fact that different gen consoles got moreless content is also an insult to customers 

The city is by far the best theyve done yet Its vast and beautiful and very well realized I love driving around in it Its added by the fact that you can put your own music in the radio Thats something that should be a standard today The commercials they add really make it better 

The story and three protag concept is cool and it works very well I cant say I care for it or the characters These have never been why I played GTA in the first place The constant bickering just wears thin far too fast

I like the arcade feeling of the driving in this over the fish tailing of GTA 4s cars Motorcycles are actually usable again 

Sadly theres just so many problems with this game

First the game is not optimized well On a 3070 running 1080p at 60 fps I had to turn MXAA off to get over 30fps It held a solid 60 until I went underwater It would sit around 15fps underwater This is just terrible The standards of poor games people accept today just makes me sad

The whole structure of the game is poor If you want any chance of making money you have to do the story first What little reward there is to having all that money is just planes and helicopters that cant really be used as all the meaningful gameplay is gone Businesses have such a poor Return Of Investment youll be waiting forever for them to pay off Cars are absolutely worthless except to look at in story mode If you buy them they can disappear in seconds you cant use them in most missions because Rockstar has once again failed to innovate on their lazy programming You go out of your way to grind money for a car take it to a missionand once again they stick you with the shittiest car because they dont understand how to make a game difficult Therefore theres no point to going after money or vehicles In multiplayer your cars get saved Not in story mode because they dont care about it They specifically devalue their own product This is the same thing they do in Max Payne 3 where he constantly throws away machine guns to pull out a pistol That shits just amateur hour

The mission structure often fails as they stick you in a position where Michael drives and Franklin shoots They put the characters in positions where their abilities arent useful This makes meaningful gameplay hard as the game is catered against its strengths When I picked ending C they disable sprint in the firefightyep Theyre that desperate to fake difficulty

Collision physics are inconsistent You dont know what will stop you dead or get knocked over This wasnt as big of a problem  in past games

The hidden packages dont appear unless you save and reload the game They dont tell you this and they actually patched this is in 

 The AI is dumb and often drives right into you

The police come when you punch someone out in the middle of nowherebecause birds call them not a joke Artificial difficulty is lazy work Yes its easy to lose thembut it becomes tedious time consumption for no reason The police are very inconsistent Sometimes a one star level takes minutes while a two star level takes seconds to lose Theyre not difficult just annoying

here is something for everyone in GTA Online Whether you want to race cars fly planes rob banks or just explore the vast world of Los Santos there is something to keep you entertained The game is also constantly being updated with new content including new missions vehicles weapons and clothing

One of the best things about GTA Online is the sense of community There are millions of players from all over the world who are always looking for new people to play with You can join crews create your own custom jobs or just hop into a random session and meet new people

If you are looking for a fun challenging and rewarding online experience then GTA Online is the game for you It is a game that you can keep coming back to for years to come

Here are some of the things that make GTA Online so great

Massive world to explore Los Santos is a sprawling city with a lot to see and do There are mountains to climb beaches to swim at and plenty of hidden secrets to discover
Variety of activities There are a ton of different things to do in GTA Online You can race cars fly planes rob banks play golf or just explore the world
Constantly evolving Rockstar Games is constantly adding new content to GTA Online This includes new missions vehicles weapons and clothing
Sense of community There is a large and active community of players in GTA Online You can join crews create your own custom jobs or just hop into a random session and meet new people
If you are looking for a fun challenging and rewarding online experience then GTA Online is the game for you It is a game that you can keep coming back to for years to come

Here are some of the continuing downloadable content that has been released for GTA Online

Heists Heists are some of the most challenging and rewarding activities in GTA Online They require teamwork and coordination to complete and they can be a lot of fun
Special Events Rockstar Games often hosts special events in GTA Online These events can include new modes vehicles or clothing
Updates Rockstar Games releases regular updates for GTA Online These updates add new content fix bugs and improve the game
The continuing downloadable content for GTA Online is one of the things that makes the game so great It keeps the game fresh and exciting and it gives players a reason to keep coming back

Grand Theft Auto V GTA 5 is an immensely popular video game known for its openworld gameplay captivating storyline and extensive multiplayer features The game offers a vast and detailed virtual world to explore allowing players to engage in thrilling missions car chases and heists The pros of GTA 5 include its immersive and visually stunning graphics diverse range of playable characters and the freedom it grants players to navigate the virtual environment The multiplayer component GTA Online offers an expansive multiplayer experience with numerous activities and missions However the game does have some cons to consider It contains mature content and explicit violence which may not be suitable for all players or age groups Additionally the games size and complexity can be overwhelming for some and it may require a significant time investment to fully explore and appreciate all its features Overall GTA 5 provides an expansive and immersive experience but its mature content and complexity should be taken into account before

GTA Online is the worst online multiplayer experience ever It almost feels like a game such as GTA should never have online features Half the time I feel like I was in a boring dream Missions heists and what not take too long with redundant driving from one point to another and lack of vehicle spawn If your chopper blows up in the middle of the desert youre d o n e fucked 

Yes some deathmatches races and all that events can be fun but if I wanted to play those game modes Id rather play other games As for the heists the thing that gets you a lot of money quicker its like being tortured more painful than when Trevor tortured that dude For one connection errors are more common to encounter than the actual players who are willing to join the heist What worse is that once youve got some players ready and you finally get to hear the mission instructions your fellow crew mates would grief the fuck out of you with all that hack trainer or some shit Sure that sure sounds like fun The heistsmission are very long with the long drive and thousands of npcs to be killed so it makes sense if you need other players as they might help you travel faster and kill npcs faster Truth is you cant rely on other players for helping you because most likely theyd rather be trolls I know I can play with friends and family but they are smart enough to avoid this shit

Money is important So important that you need money to have fun in the game Some missionsheists requires you to buy some properties To earn money you should do contract mission or events these contract missionsevents dont even get you loads of cash Meanwhile the properties you need to buy are way too expensive Luckily these contract missionsevent can be done in solo however even so the missions are made for multiplayer so it takes so long Wait whats this oh you can buy money with money Thats right You want to buy these ingame properties to enjoy the additional missions but you dont like grinding for money because its boring Just give Rockstar your cash

Seriously I would prefer Rockstar to make dlcs to the main game for additional gameplay stories and ingame stuff than this online bullshit

Grand Theft Auto V is a masterpiece of openworld design storytelling and sandbox freedom Its immersive world complex characters and darkly humorous narrative provide an unparalleled playground for virtual crime sprees While its mature themes and occasional mission hiccups might deter some for those willing to dive into the gritty underbelly of Los Santos GTA V is an unforgettable experience that leaves a lasting mark long after the final credits roll Just remember with great power comes great responsibility and a healthy dose of explosives for when things inevitably get chaotic

 GAMEPLAY 
Living breathing sandbox Los Santos and Blaine County overflow with vibrant detail from bustling city streets to sunbaked deserts offering endless opportunities for exploration and mayhem
Three unforgettable protagonists Michael Franklin and Trevor are more than just playable characters theyre flawed complex individuals with motivations that twist and turn as the story unfolds
Cinematic storytelling From pulsepounding action sequences to darkly comedic exchanges GTA V delivers a rollercoaster ride of a narrative that rivals Hollywood blockbusters
Unparalleled online playground GTA Online extends the experience with a constantly evolving world of cooperative heists competitive showdowns and playercreated chaos

Mature often offensive content Violence nudity and strong language are abundant making GTA V unsuitable for younger audiences
Mission design can be uneven Some missions feel repetitive or frustrating occasionally breaking the narrative flow
Microtransactions in GTA Online While not paytowin some may find the optional ingame purchases for faster progression intrusive

 PRICE

Grand Theft Auto V stands as a towering achievement in the world of gaming offering an openworld experience thats as exhilarating as it is expansive Set in the sprawling fictional city of Los Santos this game seamlessly blends action narrative depth and boundless exploration

From the moment you step foot into this virtual metropolis the attention to detail is staggering The city feels alive teeming with a diverse population bustling streets and a vibrant ecosystem that reacts to your every move The level of immersion is unmatched as you navigate a world that feels as dynamic and unpredictable as our own

But beyond its stunning visuals and vast open world its the intertwining stories of three distinct protagonists that elevate this game to greatness Michael Franklin and Trevor each bring their own flavor to the narrative offering a multifaceted perspective on the criminal underworld and their intertwining lives Their stories intertwine seamlessly providing a rich and engaging storyline that keeps you on the edge of your seat

The freedom this game affords is unparalleled Whether youre causing mayhem in the city streets engaging in highspeed pursuits or simply soaking in the details of a sunsoaked skyline theres always something to do The breadth of activities from adrenalinefueled heists to leisurely rounds of golf ensures that boredom is never an option

Furthermore GTA Online extends the experience far beyond the singleplayer campaign allowing you to dive into a persistent multiplayer world Collaborate with friends in heists compete in races or simply revel in the chaos of the openworld sandbox with countless other players

In summary Grand Theft Auto V isnt just a game its a living breathing universe of its own Its blend of immersive storytelling boundless exploration and unparalleled freedom cements its place as a titan in the gaming industry offering an experience that continues to captivate and enthrall players worldwide

Publisher and Devs are just trying to squeeze as much money they can out of you

Grand Theft Auto Online the multiplayer counterpart to the iconic GTA series has unfortunately become a prime example of a game suffering due to profitdriven decisions by its publisher TakeTwo Interactive The experience in GTA Online feels less like a playerfocused venture and more like a relentless pursuit of monetization at the expense of player enjoyment

One of the glaring issues is the inordinate focus on microtransactions TakeTwo seems more interested in squeezing every last dollar out of players than delivering a balanced and enjoyable gaming experience The exorbitant prices for ingame items coupled with the grindheavy nature of the game make it clear that the primary concern is the virtual wallet rather than player satisfaction

Updates and new content often prioritize expensive ingame purchases rather than addressing core issues and improving the overall gameplay experience It feels like TakeTwo is pushing players toward spending real money to stay relevant in the game creating a sense of frustration and exclusion for those who may not be willing or able to invest additional funds

The rampant presence of hackers and modders further compounds the problem creating an environment where legitimate players are left to fend for themselves against unfair advantages Instead of addressing these concerns TakeTwos focus appears to be on releasing new moneymaking content neglecting the need for a fair and secure gaming environment

In conclusion the current state of GTA Online reflects a disheartening prioritization of profit over player satisfaction by TakeTwo Interactive The game has devolved into a grindheavy microtransactionladen experience that often leaves players feeling frustrated and alienated Its a stark reminder that a games success should be measured by more than just its financial gains

In the city of Los Santos a young hustler falls under the wing of a former criminal living a difficult retirement Circumstances lead to the pair to have to do a job to pay off a debt  a job which gets national coverage and draws unwanted attention from a former partner corrupt cops ruthless movie moguls rival gangs aggressive fitness fanatics and many others

I have played this game series on and off over the years but criminally did not play the former one based in Los Santos but instead rejoined with GTA4 a game I enjoyed but not one without its flaws The good news with V is that the game keeps the strengths of the fourth game but makes many improvements which produce a much more fun and enjoyable experience across many aspects The first thing to say is that the world of LS is technically amazing in terms of its attention to detail and beauty  it is hard to describe to people who decide they do not like these games but to see a glorious sunset from a hillside with perfect shadow effects and vegetation movement and know that someone designed and made this not just filmed it is something that hit me over and over throughout the game The map is enjoyably large with diverse landscapes and character and I still find great pleasure in just going around in it even if I have nothing specific to do

The story is solid enough for the game even if it is rather generic and overblown The characters are quite clichéd in some regards Michaels story for instance is not so imaginative and generally I found him the least of the characters Franklin is similar but covered by him being the intro character so I stayed close to him throughout Trevor is a wonderfully violent and funny character and his entrance is memorable and really shakes the game up The events of the story are necessarily overblown but this is part of the fun and generally I liked the flow to it The many supporting characters are great fun and the energy and color of it all does cover up for the fact that the story is not really that complex or engaging at times As it is though it is about events and setpieces and the game provides plenty of fun memorable missions admittedly as well as a handful of awful ones and in this way there are loads of missions to replay and enjoy and most importantly this game actually allows you to load them to do just that

Side missions add color and fun and although I do miss ongoing missions like the vigilante ones from IV there is still plenty to do The range of vehicles adds to this and I also enjoyed how much easier they are to drive than in the previous game Weapon customization and the range of them provide fun destruction although the police are a lot more aggressive in this game than in IV so it is harder to go on a rampage and make it last In theory the Online world offers endless gaming  I tried it for one evening and it was fun despite all the issues but the community seemed messed up and very reliant on having an existing group of players  it looks fun but Im just more of an offline player these days

Grand Theft Auto V is a great game even if you only play the days and days of content in the single player game Technically the game is astounding with its attention to detail and just the sheer beauty of the audio and visual design of the whole world The plot is solid enough to do the job while the characters main and supporting are colorful enough to engage while playing through missions which are mostly enjoyable and offer plenty of big setpieces that are overblown and fun

Grand Theft Auto V A Timeless Triumph in Gaming Excellence

Rating 

Grand Theft Auto V stands as a towering achievement in the world of gaming a testament to Rockstar Games unrivaled ability to craft a virtual experience that transcends entertainment Even years after its initial release GTA V remains an absolute masterpiece continually drawing players into the vibrant and chaotic world of Los Santos

From the moment you step into the meticulously crafted city the level of detail is staggering Los Santos is a living breathing entity pulsating with energy and realism The games visuals are a feast for the eyes showcasing Rockstars commitment to pushing the boundaries of what is possible in an openworld setting The attention to detail from the bustling city streets to the serene countryside is nothing short of aweinspiring

But what truly elevates GTA V to legendary status is its narrative brilliance The intertwining stories of Michael Franklin and Trevor create a narrative tapestry that is as compelling as any Hollywood blockbuster The characters are richly developed each with their own motivations and quirks making them more than just protagonists  theyre complex flawed individuals you cant help but invest in

The heist missions a hallmark of the GTA series are the epitome of gaming excellence The level of strategic planning coupled with the freedom to execute plans in various ways provides a sense of agency rarely seen in other games Whether youre orchestrating a daring bank heist or engaging in highspeed pursuits the gameplay is a perfect blend of challenge and sheer fun

GTA Vs soundtrack is a work of art in itself The radio stations boast an eclectic mix of music catering to diverse tastes and the original score seamlessly complements the onscreen action The attention to audio detail from the roar of engines to the ambient sounds of the city further immerses players in the games world

The longevity of GTA V is also owed to its dynamic online multiplayer mode GTA Online This everexpanding world offers limitless opportunities for cooperative and competitive play ensuring that the Grand Theft Auto experience extends far beyond the confines of the singleplayer campaign

In conclusion Grand Theft Auto V isnt just a game its a cultural phenomenon that has left an indelible mark on the gaming landscape Rockstar Games has crafted an experience that transcends its medium delivering a perfect blend of narrative depth visual splendor and engaging gameplay Whether youre a seasoned gamer or new to the series GTA V is an absolute mustplay  a timeless triumph that continues to redefine the possibilities of interactive entertainment

My 18 year old ask me to reinstall the game and in doing so I noticed that I had yet to review the game  We have at the time of this review over 320 hours play time on the PC with nearly double that on the PS4   Funny thing is that we have never even completed the story campaign or played on the online portion   The vast majority of the time was just my daughter and I making tons and tons of mayhem   Well more me making the mayhem and her going on joy rides

For years now she has asked me when GTVA 6 was coming out and she was so glad to hear that it was finally coming out in a couple more years  I dont care what people say I am glad for her that she will finally have a female antihero to play as  In the past we have always modded the game just so she could play as a female character   I tire of people saying a game is woke just because it has a female lead  Grow up and get with the current century is what I have to say and I am in my fifties so it isnt like I am a Millennial or Gen Z saying this   If you dont like the character being female do the opposite of what we did and mod the character to a male

Anyway it is amazing how much fun this game is just driving around and sightseeing even after all these years the game still holds up as a decent looking game  Rockstar put heart and soul into the game and it shows

By the way if you ever get a chance to meet Steven Ogg voice of Trevor in real life do it  The dude is hundred kinds of funny and a cool dude all around

At a discount I totally recommend this game It can be a fun bit Unfortunately it didnt quite hit the mark for me it becomes too repetitive I feel like I spent most of my time in the game driving around the city 

The characters lack depth appearing rather onedimensional Although theyre intended as satirical figures I found the critique of society lacking due to a lack of insightful storytelling The excessive violence and torture felt out of place lacking context and purpose devoid of any impactful consequences Some side missions were entertaining yet others felt mundane and offered little reward contributing to an overall weak storyline Despite moments of entertaining banter between characters there was a notable absence of character progression leaving them seemingly unchanged from the games start to near completion I stopped right before the final heist

Investing in properties within the game felt pointless the money spent never returns requiring an extensive grind to acquire them all which didnt appeal to me

Although there were enjoyable moments in the game there were also instances where playing it left me with a sense of discomfort or unease I wont delve into the portrayal of women in the game as objects or unable to exhibit ruthlessness However I found the inclusion of the therapist character puzzling Was it intended as satire Therapy remains taboo in many societies so why not explore that notion Why not play with societys perceptions of therapy Instead it seemed evident that the therapy sessions in the game were not genuine therapy but rather another aimless story arc leaving me questioning its purpose and significance 

As for the online mode it could potentially be enjoyable with friends However the high cost of items and the grind required were significant deterrents While the concept of owning businesses seemed promising the execution made it more of a chore than a pleasure The delivery missions were timeconsuming the process of checking supplies at businesses in person felt tedious and the excessive hours needed to play repetitive missions for incremental progress towards a new and improved business felt unreasonable

Saw the GTA6 trailer was very impressed found out this was on sale for all of 10 including GTA Online Scooped it And I couldnt be happier

The game is over 10 years old as of this commentary and I never got to play GTA4 yet so its been an enormous gap since I played GTASA on the PS2 for reference Ive played since the very first GTA on the PS1 along with GTA2 GTA3 and GTAVC as well

The level of depth and immersion blew me away and would have had my teenage self floored because I played the older titles for their immersion The story was so much fun to unravel and I especially loved the Trevor character The sheer amount of things to do were so many that I probably wont be able to 100 this game any time soon But what really struck me was how faithful they were to referencing their older titles including a car from GTA2 which is like the bastard child of the franchise it seems

Its all the fun and frantic openworld destroyeverything GTA was always known for with a massive city and a more rural county chock full of weapons to play with a load of cars of all different types that dont look repetitive after a while new minigames and RPG elements

The only sad thing is that unlike GTASA they had to remove the cities of San Fierro and Las Venturas because that would have just made the world map so immense that this game would probably be so much bigger to install than it already is now Still with how deep they have been going plus what I saw with the GTA6 trailer who knows if theyll make some kind of altUSA travel system to do this sort of thing and interconnect them along with Liberty City and Vice City Im looking at you GTA Online

100 recommend Its the 5th major installment of a beloved franchise and it really delivers its entertainment especially if youre into openworld immersion

From a singleplayer perspective the game is nothing short of an excellent experience the story isnt the best in the series but is a great parody of modern america Each of the three characters have their own narrative that collides with each other to feel unique and relevant to the main plot The choice of endings are obvious and not necessarily compelling which leaves a half baked finish to the game But the first 23 of the game have excellent character development and writing The open world is great but feels empty Its more or less a travel hub to go from point A to point B but has a good level of detail and almost every part is used productively The online portion of the game sucks and is boring using the same open world as single player with very few things different or interesting to see and do Unless you have a small army of people to play with multiplayer is a cash grabbing joke The whole of the single player is what holds up to this day 9010

Grand Theft Auto V GTA 5 stands as a true masterpiece in the gaming world combining a sprawling open world gripping storytelling and an unparalleled level of detail From the bustling streets of Los Santos to the vast countryside and beyond the games world is a vibrant playground filled with limitless possibilities

What sets GTA 5 apart is its seamless blend of action exploration and narrative The games three protagonists offer unique perspectives each with their own compelling stories and motivations creating a rich and engaging experience Whether embarking on adrenalinefueled heists exploring the diverse landscapes or simply causing chaos in the sandbox world the game ensures theres always something exciting to do

The attention to detail in GTA 5 is staggering from the lifelike NPC behavior to the meticulously designed environments The games multiplayer component GTA Online further extends the experience offering a dynamic and evolving online world where players can engage in various activities missions and challenges with friends or other players worldwide

GTA 5s longevity and continued popularity stem from its constant updates extensive modding community and the dedication of the developers to refine and expand the game It remains a benchmark in openworld gaming delivering an unforgettable experience that keeps players coming back for more

Grand Theft Auto V the latest instalment in the controversial yet wildly popular franchise delivers just that First released in 2013 the game has since been remastered and optimised for PC offering players a chance to experience this sprawling crime epic in stunning 4K resolution and 60fps 

Set in the fictional city of Los Santos GTA 5 provides a vivid recreation of Southern California and all the seedy underbelly it encapsulates The game offers a scathing and satirical take on the American Dream through its interweaving story of three criminals from very different walks of life

h2Storylineh2
As you progress through the game you are confronted with moral dilemmas and complex relationships in a world filled with crime corruption and the constant pursuit of power

What sets GTA 5 apart is its unparalleled attention to detail and the sheer scope of its openworld environment Los Santos evokes the feeling that it is a living breathing city bustling with pedestrians traffic and countless activities to engage in You could participate in street races play a round of golf enjoy a bike ride along the coastline or visit a strip club

GTA 5s story mode is a mammoth task with any one of the characters  Michael Franklin or Trevor  providing enough narrative for an entire game Combined they offer an intricate plotline with the highest standard of writing Once introduced you can freely switch between these characters each with personality traits and strengths

Franklin a streetwise hustler with a good heart can drive in slow motion Michael in witness protection tries to leave his criminal past behind Trevor is an unpredictable and volatile character who thrives on chaos

h2Gameplayh2
players can engage in various forms of gameplay such as completing missions participating in heists and exploring the open world

h3Shooting Mechanicsh3
While the base shooting mechanics have held up reasonably well since 2013 there are now thirdperson cover shooters that feel more fluid However GTA 5s shooting is still immensely enjoyable

h3Missionsh3
With multiple approaches to complete objectives you can tailor missions to your preferred playstyle Whether employing stealth direct confrontation or strategic planning the diversity of options ensures that gameplay never feels repetitive or monotonous

The variety of missions and mechanics guarantees that players remain engaged and excited You may enact a meticulously planned heist engage in intense gang warfare or embark on an adrenalinefueled chase sequence

h3Customisationh3
Players can shape unique experiences by changing outfits customising vehicles or exploring the openworld environment The plethora of choices for players adds replayability even after completing the main story

h3Open Worldh3
Players are granted almost total freedom to explore the vast metropolis of Los Santos and the surrounding countryside

Driving through the city evokes a palpable sense of place with responsive vehicle handling and collision physics creating an authentic experience whether navigating dense traffic in a sports car or offroading in a 4x4 Piloting aircraft opens up new vistas from scenic coastal flights to heartpounding aerial stunts The open waters surrounding the city are equally inviting to explore by boat or submarine

An astonishing array of side activities are scattered worldwide from recreational pursuits like golf tennis and cycling to more illicit diversions Stranger encounters introduce memorably eccentric characters and side missions with compelling selfcontained stories Collectibles like letter scraps and spaceship parts encourage exploration while revealing more about the world and characters but no one knows this

h3Driving Mechanicsh3
The driving mechanics of GTA 5 are unrivalled and constantly comparing other openworld driving games to GTA games like Just Cause Watch_Dogs and Saints Row just to name a few doesnt even come close to the pure satisfaction I get from the multitude of vehicles I have at my disposal and how vastly differing they all feel to navigate through the streets of Los Santos

h2Stunning Visuals for 2013h2
Everything from the character models to the buildings and terrain is meticulously detailed3 The lighting and particle effects are also remarkably realistic showcasing beautiful sunrises and sunsets and how dust kicks up from offroad driving These visuals combined with the seamless transition between the city and the open countryside make exploring the world a visually arresting experience

h3Cinematic Soundtrackh3
The original score for GTA 5 was composed to create tension during action sequences and a sense of ambience while free roaming or completing mundane tasks The game also features licensed music spread across 15 radio stations including hiphop rock and country genres Players can simply cruise down the freeway and enjoy the scenery while listening to their favourite tunes

h2Onlineh2
After nearly a decade on the market GTA 5 Online remains a polarising experience For all its ambition and scale the game struggles to balance engaging openworld gameplay with an incentive structure that pushes players toward griefing and other toxic behaviour Though recent updates have aimed to curb the worst excesses of the community the problems run deeper in the very framework of how GTA 5 Online functions 

If you can find a group of likeminded players there are glimpses of the promised fun and hijinks But for most GTA 5 Online is a cautionary tale of how even the most sprawling virtual worlds can feel empty when not built with community in mind You may enter with an open mind ready for adventure but leave with a sobering reminder of the darker impulses that emerge when there are no consequences For a game that holds up a mirror to society its a reflection we may not wish to see

h2Conclusionh2
Overall Grand Theft Auto V is an impressively ambitious and complex game that pushes the envelope of openworld gaming and storytelling The massive scope of its gameplay and intricate story should satisfy even the most hardcore GTA fans While not without its flaws and controversies GTA V is a technical and creative marvel that provides hours of entertainment and escapism 

Suppose you want to immerse yourself in a satirical take on modern culture with engaging characters and nonstop action In that case youll find it hard to beat this sprawling crime epic With so much to see and do in the world of Los Santos GTA V stands out as one of the most compelling openworld experiences in gaming

Grand Theft Auto V A Tale of Two Realities  A Stellar Campaign Overshadowed by Online Chaos

My experience with Grand Theft Auto V has been a rollercoaster of emotions swinging between awe and frustration While the singleplayer campaign is undeniably cool and engaging the online portion of the game has left a bitter taste in my mouth due to the rampant hacking issues that plague the experience

Lets start with the positive aspect the campaign Rockstar Games has crafted a narrative masterpiece with an engaging storyline diverse characters and a sprawling openworld that begs to be explored The singleplayer experience is a testament to the studios prowess in storytelling and game design providing players with a captivating journey through the criminal underworld of Los Santos

However the real allure of Grand Theft Auto V lies in its online mode Its a shame that Rockstar Games seems to turn a blind eye to the overwhelming hack scene that has infested the online realm Hackers run rampant and their presence transforms what should be a thrilling multiplayer experience into a chaotic and frustrating mess From money hacks to invincibility cheats the online portion of the game feels like a lawless Wild West where legitimate players are left to fend for themselves against the onslaught of malicious exploits

The sad truth is that Rockstar Games despite their immense resources and player community feedback has not done enough to rein in the hack scene across all their games This negligence not only undermines the integrity of the online experience in Grand Theft Auto V but also casts a shadow over the multiplayer aspects of their other titles Its disheartening to see a company of such stature failing to address a persistent issue that has been affecting their player base for far too long

As much as the campaign showcases Rockstars brilliance the allure of the online world is where the real fun is at The fact that this experience is marred by the unchecked proliferation of hackers is a major letdown Until Rockstar Games takes decisive action to curb the hack scene and create a more secure online environment Grand Theft Auto Vs online mode will remain a frustrating and unfulfilling playground for those seeking genuine multiplayer enjoyment

Gameplay  810
Whilst some people may dislike the Rockstar gameplay formula as it certainly isnt for everyone I like it and it has made me come back to the story missions of this game about 3 times across all the platforms that I have played it on now The gun play in this game is satisfying for me as the guns really feel like they have power behind them Driving mechanics are fun and easy

Story  610
I wasnt too interested for most of the story and whilst there were some cool mission based around the story and some funny moments in the cut scenes it was mainly the gameplay that kept me playing

Graphics  710
The graphics of this game still hold up quite well today and Im sure they will for a while There are little details in some models that make the game world feel real and like there are many moving parts to each object Explosion and fire effects still look good and are satisfying to watch

Performance  910
I had some performance issues when I first started playing this game on PC but I have put that down to driver issues as they have disappeared since

Online  610
Personally the online never really interested me much but I think that it is mainly down to the fact that I dont have a group of friends that I can play it with to properly get into it and that would keep me coming back There is plenty to do in the online for people who like that sort of stuff though I just personally prefer single player games

Overall  910
If you havent played this game yet then I would recommend that you do so before GTA 6 releases within the next 58329 years

A Modern Gaming Masterpiece GTA V Review Rating  After investing a staggering 793 hours into Grand Theft Auto V I can confidently say that it is an absolute gaming masterpiece Rockstar Games has once again delivered an unparalleled openworld experience that surpasses all expectations The level of detail in Los Santos is mindblowing Every street corner building and NPC feels alive and vibrant creating an immersive environment that constantly begs to be explored The attention to detail is remarkable showcasing a level of craftsmanship seldom seen in gaming The storyline is gripping filled with unexpected twists and turns that keep you on the edge of your seat Each character has a distinct personality and their intertwining narratives provide a deep and engaging experience that is both humorous and emotionally charged The gameplay too is exceptional The controls are smooth and intuitive allowing for seamless transitions between driving shooting and participating in various activities From highspeed police chases to intense heists and exhilarating stunt jumps there is always something to do and a sense of freedom that is unparalleled GTA V boasts an expansive multiplayer mode that further amplifies the games longevity Whether its joining a crew and engaging in epic battles or simply exploring the vast open world with friends the multiplayer component provides endless hours of entertainment and camaraderie Furthermore the constant updates and DLCs released by Rockstar Games have kept the game fresh and exciting From new vehicles and weapons to challenging missions and events the developers commitment to the games ongoing support is commendable However its worth mentioning that the game does contain mature content and violence which may not be suitable for all audiences While it successfully explores darker themes its important for players to approach it with maturity and awareness All in all Grand Theft Auto V is an exceptional game that has undoubtedly become a cultural phenomenon With its stunning visuals captivating narrative and an expansive open world that begs to be explored it is a mustplay for any gaming enthusiast Despite the countless hours invested the game continues to surprise and captivate me making it a definite contender for the title of the greatest game of all time I cannot recommend GTA V enough Whether youre a fan of the series or new to the world of GTA this game is a true masterpiece that should not be missed Happy gaming Note The rating and review are based on personal experience and may differ from individual to individual

If youre looking for a review on this game youve come to the wrong place but if youre looking for an outstanding pie recipe youve come to the right place

Ingredients

1 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2 12 cup white sugar
3 12 cup brown sugar
4 14 cup water
5 14 teaspoon cinnamon
6 1 pinch salt
7 5 apples  peeled cored and sliced
8 1 pastry for doublecrust pie

Directions

1 Preheat oven to 425 degrees F 220 degrees C
2 Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside
3 Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9inch pie plate Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices
4 Roll out top crust into a 10inch circle Cut into 8 1inch wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal
5 Pour buttersugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust
6 Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes Reduce heat to 350 degrees F 175 degrees C and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes Allow to cool completely before slicing

NB I havent been a fan of the series though I enjoyed RDR2 a lot so if you are or want to try it out maybe this review isnt for you Also as I understand the overwhelming majority of people now buy it for Online which I also dont care about this is about the singleplayer mode

So Ive played quite a few huge sandbox games Ive even 100 or close to 100 completed quite a few Why does GTA V not work for me in that regard

Well really the answer is quite simple despite being a huge open world with many many activities you bcouldb do I dont particularly care to actually do any of them It is honestly quite baffling as to how much work the game developers have put into things that just seem completely out of place and pointless You can do parachute jumps You can play tennis You can do plane stunts You can do a triathlon You can buy property You can participate in car races You can do yoga You can play golf You can buy and sell stock on the stock market You can use your inconvenient phone camera which makes you stand completely still while you use it to take pictures of wildlife that kills you in one hit

But is that really why Id play a Grand Theft Auto game

Sure there are still the main missions and a few side ones but completing ALL of them took me less than 40 hours and that included some messing around which is quite a feat for a large sandbox

But heres the thing I didnt bactuallyb complete all of the side missions Why Well because I have no way to know how to do that

One issue is that some side missions seem to be locked behind buying particular properties which is not only completely notobvious especially since not all of them do that but also requires you to either finish the game to get any money to spare or abuse the stock market system which due to its own quirks can be quite hard to do without a guide Others are random as in while they have specific points where they can trigger you wouldnt know what these points are without a guide and they might bnotb trigger there even if youre nearby purely by chance Yet others require even more obscure ways of starting them

Lastly there are several collectathon missions in the game but seriously screw them No markers no clues no nothing Apparently one of the protagonist trio can use his dog to search for bsomeb of the collectibles but the game never explained it or that its even possible so good luck figuring that without a guide And even then youd need to run around the huge map to do this

Its a good thing that I didnt even try to get 100 though because apparently one of the completion marks requires the use of a separate mobile app which has been at this point removed from stores Wompwomp

Gameplaywise GTA V feels smoother than GTA IV though thats not saying much The flight controls are as horrendous as ever going for completely misplaced realism The police are cheating bastards who know what your location is at any point in time can spawn out of thin air and have cars that rubberband to you no matter what making upgrading cars for speed pretty much pointless Your health regenerates only up to half and there are rarely any health pick ups and no armor pick ups forcing you to stay in cover most of the time in a shootout

The story is not very gripping either mostly concerning not particularly likable people doing things for extremely petty reasons The best part of the game are heist missions purely because of how you get to choose how they go even if in reality there arent that many ways your choices affect them bar the one major one on the selected approach method Unfortunately there are only a few of those throughout the entire game and I honestly dont know why else would I recommend it

Great game especially with friends The graphics are really good and the game is very well optimized as well even an entry level computer of today could run it well There are also lots of things to do in this game Stuff like messing around missions heists mini games story mode etc Like seriously theres an insane amount of stuff to do The game has so much play value 

What I like most in the game was the heists the challenging content of the game doomsday heist playing with friends collecting cars and weapons messing around and the environment 

The game is worth every penny I highly recommend it

Like its GTA it was fun to go back to something Ive not played in nearly ten years its nice to revisit the map and having some new characters campaigns vehicles and things to do but thats it The game has not improved combat and character movement is still awful driving gets boring quickly and all the new jobs missions heists and vehicles feel tacked on nothing actually feels new or very interesting

The worst thing is the actual online side everyone is there just to prevent regular players attempting missions or trying to start missions I understand people messing about with new vehicles theyve bought but its just so lame that thats what some people do every night of their lives its almost as douche as buying hacks or even worse buying in game money from Rockstar My worst personal experience was a multiplayer mission where at the end everyone was spawned together so one players killed everyone else and stole everyones money Good Game design 

You can get away from all the other online players by selecting a new session and invite only but this only really helps if you want to play solo My main interest in the game was to play coop with a buddy its doable but its a total ball ache as you will spend almost half your time in loading screens you cant just play together as you constantly have to invite the other player to do something and if you finish a mission together then you are both put back into separate lobbies

I wish I hadnt bothered with the online the only thing that its taught me is that Rockstar seriously needs to pull some magic off for GTA6 to be good Im sure its going to look incredible and be an insanely detailed world just like RDR2 but they need to reassess their gameplay unless the only people they are catering for are twelve year old boys with ADHD

If youre looking for a review on this game youve come to the wrong place but if youre looking for an outstanding Brawnys recipe youve come to the right place

Ingredients

1 cup 2 sticks unsalted butter
2 cups granulated sugar
1 cup allpurpose flour
1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
12 teaspoon baking powder
12 teaspoon salt
4 large eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips optional
1 cup chopped nuts optional
Instructions

Preheat Oven
1 Preheat your oven to 175C Grease the baking pan or line it with parchment paper
2 In a mediumsized saucepan melt the butter over low heat Remove from heat once melted
3 In a large mixing bowl whisk together the sugar flour cocoa powder baking powder and salt
4 Add the melted butter to the dry ingredients and stir until well combined
5 Beat in the eggs one at a time ensuring each egg is fully incorporated before adding the next one Stir in the vanilla extract
6 If desired fold in chocolate chips and chopped nuts to add extra texture and flavor
7 Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and spread it evenly Bake in the preheated oven for about 2530 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs not wet batter
8 Allow the brownies to cool in the pan for about 1015 minutes then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely before cutting
9 Once the brownies are completely cooled cut them into squares or rectangles Enjoy

Feel free to customize this recipe to suit your preferences You can add ingredients like caramel swirls different types of nuts or even a sprinkle of sea salt on top for an extra special touch Enjoy your delicious homemade brownies

Grand Theft Auto V GTA V developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games stands as a magnum opus in the gaming industry redefining openworld experiences and narrativedriven gameplay Originally released in 2013 and continually updated GTA V remains an enduring masterpiece that seamlessly blends a vast immersive world with compelling storytelling unparalleled attention to detail and a plethora of activities that captivate players for hours on end

The visual spectacle of Los Santos the games fictional representation of Los Angeles is nothing short of breathtaking The meticulously crafted cityscape diverse landscapes and dynamic weather effects contribute to an everevolving and living environment Character animations facial expressions and the sheer scale of the game world showcase Rockstars commitment to pushing the boundaries of gaming visuals

At the narrative core of GTA V are three protagonistsMichael Franklin and Trevoreach with a unique personality background and skill set The intersecting storylines provide a rich and multifaceted narrative that explores themes of crime ambition and the pursuit of the American Dream The character development is masterful creating a compelling emotional connection with each protagonist even as players navigate the morally ambiguous world they inhabit

The openworld design of GTA V is a triumph in player freedom The sprawling city and surrounding areas offer an abundance of activities from highstakes heists and adrenalinefueled car chases to more leisurely pursuits like golf and yoga The attention to detail extends to the dynamic ecosystem of the city with pedestrians going about their lives engaging in conversations and reacting realistically to the players actions

The games driving and combat mechanics are refined and responsive offering a satisfying blend of realism and accessibility The vast array of vehicles weapons and customization options provides players with the tools to approach missions and freeroaming in their unique style

GTA Online the multiplayer component of the game further expands the experience It allows players to engage in various cooperative and competitive activities build criminal enterprises and explore Los Santos with friends The ongoing support from Rockstar with regular updates new content and events ensures that the online experience remains dynamic and engaging

The soundtrack of GTA V deserves special mention featuring an eclectic mix of genres and a curated radio station lineup that adds depth to the games atmosphere The voice acting led by stellar performances from the main cast enhances the overall cinematic quality of the experience

While the game has received criticism for its mature content and occasionally controversial themes it undeniably represents a pinnacle in interactive storytelling offering players an unprecedented level of agency in a virtual world

In conclusion Grand Theft Auto V stands as a titan in the gaming industry seamlessly blending an expansive openworld environment with a gripping narrative exceptional character development and an array of activities that keep players enthralled Its enduring popularity and ongoing relevance speak to its status as a benchmark for what a video game can achieve GTA V is not just a game its a cultural phenomenon that continues to shape the landscape of interactive entertainment

Title A DecadeLong Journey through Los Santos GTA Vs Lasting Impact

Grand Theft Auto V a virtual playground that has been a cornerstone of my gaming existence since I first stepped into the sunsoaked streets of Los Santos at the age of 12 continues to be a defining and integral part of my gaming life As I reflect on an immersive 11year journey its clear that GTA V isnt merely a game its a dynamic and enduring chapter in the story of my digital adventures

Released in 2013 GTA Vs Los Santos immediately captivated me with its breathtaking scale and attention to detail The city was a living breathing entity teeming with diverse neighborhoods iconic landmarks and a vast open landscape that begged to be explored From the sunsets over Mount Chiliad to the vibrant lights of the Vinewood strip each corner of the map became a familiar yet endlessly captivating part of my virtual world

The narrative brilliance which has become a trademark of the Grand Theft Auto series found new heights in GTA V The trio of protagonists  Michael Franklin and Trevor  brought unique perspectives to a sprawling tale of crime camaraderie and the pursuit of the American Dream The heist missions a standout feature were not just adrenalinepumping escapades but also strategic challenges that required meticulous planning and execution

GTA Vs success didnt stop at its singleplayer narrative the introduction of Grand Theft Auto Online GTAO added an entirely new dimension to the experience For the past six years my friends and I have embarked on countless adventures in Los Santos from coordinated heists to wild races and impromptu freeroam shenanigans The everexpanding world of GTA Online with its regular updates and new content has kept the virtual landscape fresh and dynamic

The games attention to detail extends beyond the narrative and into its satirical take on modern society The radio stations television shows and ingame internet provided a sharp commentary on everything from politics to pop culture enhancing the games immersion and creating a world that felt eerily reflective of our own

The gameplay mechanics refined over the years offered a perfect blend of action exploration and a sandbox for creativity The characterswitching feature improved driving physics and an extensive range of activities ensured that Los Santos never felt stale even after countless hours of play

While GTA V garnered widespread acclaim it wasnt without its controversies and critiques particularly in relation to the microtransaction model in GTA Online Yet these issues did little to diminish the overall impact of a game that has been a constant companion throughout my adolescence and early adulthood

As I reminisce about the countless hours spent in Los Santos the friendships forged in chaotic online sessions and the enduring allure of the games open world its clear that GTA V is more than just a form of entertainment Its a nostalgic time capsule a digital diary chronicling my growth as a gamer and the evolving landscape of the gaming industry over the past 11 years

In the grand tapestry of my gaming life GTA V stands tall as a masterpiece that transcends the medium Its not just a game its a virtual home a canvas for endless adventures and a testament to the lasting impact that video games can have on the fabric of our lives

How to describe the heavy snowMy teacher said so  That was eight or nine years agoI was still in primary school at that timeThe first thing I do after school every day is to turn on the computer and watch the programBy chance I met GTA5He really gave me a great shock in my childhood and then I realized that the original game could do thisSince then I have been tirelessly watching related videos every day to see how the anchors are allpowerful in Los AngelesThen I reluctantly turned off the TV when my parents urged me to eatIt was a wonderful timeIt formed my whole childhood concept of gamesUntil this year I finally played this game and walked on the streets of Los Angeles Everything was familiar and vividI have traveled to this hometown through video countless timesI finished the offline story again no I dont know how many times I relived their story but this time I witnessed it myselfAfter many years it still gave me a shock about the stories of the protagonists about my second hometown Los AngelesDriving in the street car in Los Angeles playing Sleeping WalkMy childhood has drifted away but it wont forever the capital of Los Angeles a generation of classicsAfter many years I remember when the teacher asked me how to describe the heavy snow and now I have the answer

There is something for everyone in GTA Online Whether you want to race cars fly planes rob banks or just explore the vast world of Los Santos there is something to keep you entertained The game is also constantly being updated with new content including new missions vehicles weapons and clothing

One of the best things about GTA Online is the sense of community There are millions of players from all over the world who are always looking for new people to play with You can join crews create your own custom jobs or just hop into a random session and meet new people

If you are looking for a fun challenging and rewarding online experience then GTA Online is the game for you It is a game that you can keep coming back to for years to come

Here are some of the things that make GTA Online so great

Massive world to explore Los Santos is a sprawling city with a lot to see and do There are mountains to climb beaches to swim at and plenty of hidden secrets to discover
Variety of activities There are a ton of different things to do in GTA Online You can race cars fly planes rob banks play golf or just explore the world
Constantly evolving Rockstar Games is constantly adding new content to GTA Online This includes new missions vehicles weapons and clothing
Sense of community There is a large and active community of players in GTA Online You can join crews create your own custom jobs or just hop into a random session and meet new people
If you are looking for a fun challenging and rewarding online experience then GTA Online is the game for you It is a game that you can keep coming back to for years to come

Here are some of the continuing downloadable content that has been released for GTA Online

Heists Heists are some of the most challenging and rewarding activities in GTA Online They require teamwork and coordination to complete and they can be a lot of fun
Special Events Rockstar Games often hosts special events in GTA Online These events can include new modes vehicles or clothing
Updates Rockstar Games releases regular updates for GTA Online These updates add new content fix bugs and improve the game
The continuing downloadable content for GTA Online is one of the things that makes the game so great It keeps the game fresh and exciting and it gives players a reason to keep coming back

Today I want to introduce you to a highly anticipated game Grand Theft Auto V GTA V The game is an actionadventure game developed by Rockstar Games and first released in 2013

First lets talk about the graphics of the game Grand Theft Auto V uses advanced graphics technology to make the scenes and characters in the game very realistic Whether it is the architecture of the city the natural scenery or the facial expressions of the characters every detail is carefully designed to make people feel like they are in it At the same time the animation effects of the game are very smooth making people feel like watching a Hollywood blockbuster

Next lets talk about the plot of the game Grand Theft Auto V takes place in the fictional city of Los Angeles and allows players to take on the roles of three different characters Mike Trevor and Franklin Each of these three characters has its own story arc and players need to complete missions to advance the story The whole story is tight gripping and irresistible

Finally lets talk about how the game is played Grand Theft Auto V is an action adventure game in which players are required to drive shoot sneak and more At the same time there are a variety of tasks for the player to complete these tasks not only test the players operating skills but also make the game more interesting

Overall Grand Theft Auto V is a very good game Its beautiful picture compact plot diverse gameplay people can not extricate themselves If you love action adventure games then this game must not be missed

I cant put this review on RDR2 on steam since I bought it on Microsoft Store I believe so I put it here since according to my own memories  GTAV was pretty much the same kind of design

Much of the world is persistent only as long as it is within Your cone of view Like if You watch a traffic in the industrial complex You will see a lot of heavy trailers driving and they stay on road if You follow them further outside that industrial complex but the very next moment when You pan Your view to something else outside their spawn area they are lost  despawned

Think of it as if You were trying to play a chess but You are limited to see only the half of the chess board and every time You move Your sight the chess pieces reappear randomly to create an illusion of playing a chess game that is what it means to play these kind of games
